name: unspectacular
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not particularly good or great, and not causing much admiration or excitement: He ran a solid, if unspectacular, operation. Her progress was steady but unspectacular. The result is thoroughly unspectacular. Opposite
spectacular
More examplesFewer examplesThe patient was making steady, if unspectacular, progress.This was a relatively good (if unspectacular) performance.After a solid but unspectacular start to her university career, her results improved and she graduated with a good degree. The party's electoral successes were unspectacular.Some of the meals were good, but most were unspectacular.
